qas.question: What type of painting are Bermuda artists known for?
What type of art work does Chesley Trott produce?
What significant event does the sculpture The Arrival portray?

answers.text: the freeing of slaves from the American brig Enterprise in 1835

qas.question: Who is one of Bermuda's most famous watercolourists?
Where are hand-carved cedar sculptures sold?
Who created the 7 m sculpture installed at the airport?

plausible_answers.text: the freeing of slaves from the American brig Enterprise

context: Bermuda <a0_0>watercolours<a0_0/> painted by local artists are sold at <b4_0>various galleries<b4_0/>. <a1_0>Hand-carved cedar sculptures<a1_0/> are another speciality. One such 7 ft (2.1 m) sculpture, created by Bermudian sculptor <b5_0>Chesley Trott<b5_0/>, is installed at the airport's baggage claim area. In 2010, his sculpture <b6_0>The Arrival<b6_0/> was unveiled near the bay to commemorate <a2_0><b7_0>the freeing of slaves from the American brig Enterprise<b7_0/> in 1835<a2_0/>. Local artwork may also be viewed at several galleries around the island. <a3_0>Alfred Birdsey<a3_0/> was one of the more famous and talented <b8_0>watercolourists<b8_0/>; his impressionistic landscapes of Hamilton, St George's and the surrounding sailboats, homes, and bays of Bermuda are world-renowned.
